channel.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
channel.description:
Unveiling of the next generation iPhone starting in less than an hour.
I'm with Android, but still excited to see what Jobs and the guys will come up with for the next breakthrough feature, rumoured to be extremely accurate voice control.
Discuss etc, may be able to provide a link with live coverage later.
Edit: heres the ad video for the now announced iPhone 4S - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9F6e0jPzEo4

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

probably why they didnt demo one in the ad like that

Read full topic

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
item.dc:creator: @Cbot Cbot
item.description:
@Cbot wrote:

I think it would be pretty decent in situations like driving where you can just say a location and it will give you directions. But in public areas like the train or bus, I’d agree with you SilentCJ.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Yeah, can’t imagine it being used widely, what happens on a train when there are lots of iphone users about, I’d just feel embarrassed anyway, you’d look stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

That’s why I said talking to their phone, not talking on or into a phone

EDIT: What do you class as a feature upgrade?

Read full topic

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Oh yea, talking into a phone is so strange, I don’t like it at all! /sarcasm

No, I know what you mean, I just thought it was funny.

On-topic: If, say HTC, ‘upgraded’ one of their Android phones with these tiny non-features, do you actually think anyone would swap their old phone out for the new one? I doubt it. It’s a pathetic attempt by Apple to keep up with the new Android phones coming out every day, without the fancy press releases.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

They demonstrated it live on stage, but who knows, really. If it works as they shown it to on stage, then it is fairly impressive just like Siri was before Apple bought it. I still question how people feel about talking to their phone though, but if it’s useful and easier to use (such as the wolframalpha integration) than doing it the usual way, it may catch on a bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

hurr let’s add two antennas because one is certain to fail, instead of just making the original antenna work in the first place.

This voice detection software does seem like the party piece of this update, I wonder if it actually works in the real world as it does in their fancy commercial…

Read full topic

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone

Ooooh I so hate this crap. Can’t they just piss off already.

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:17, topic:417010”]Pretty nice phone, ive been with android for awhile but don’t really like my droid x as it seems to be sluggish even after re flashing the android os back onto the phone and constantly has problems with applications crashing. Don’t plan on getting a new phone anytime soon and even if I did it would probably be another android but that voice control feature looks pretty cool. If I wasn’t worried about how I spend my money I would definitely consider it.[/quote]I have an HTC Inspire. No problems, gingerbread is hawt.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

BloodRayne:

Well I was planning on getting a 5 when it came out, because I thought it was coming out in October like the Sprint employee had thought. I don’t really want to get a 4S if there is going to be a 5 in the coming months, or will it be longer then that? If so, I’ll probably get an Evo 4g

Get evo 3d, more up to date.

Read full topic

Don’t plan on getting a new phone anytime soon and even if I did it would probably be another android but that voice control feature looks pretty cool. If I wasn’t worried about how I spend my money I would definitely consider it.

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

They’re doing what they’ve done the 3GS. Just a spec bump to bring it up (speed wise) with newer competitors. They’re on an Intel-like Tick-tock model, it seems. The 4S isn’t the iPhone 5, obviously. It’s the 4S, like it says.

Bleh.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:

So much for the bigger screen with no bezel too.

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

I’m confused, is the iPhone 4S the new iPhone 5 or what?

I don’t follow Apple products much, I don’t know what S means etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple - Let's talk iPhone
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:4, topic:417010”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=518949.msg3771657#msg3771657 date=1317745021]
The new iPhone would be a little slimmer and little faster. And the new feature is the revolutionary new antenna that doesn’t drop calls.

And not to forget aluminum cover and somewhat better resolution.
[/quote]Oh, so you mean like… all of the flaws they purposely put into the iPhone4, they’re just going to call all of the fixes a new version?[/quote]
Yes, but everyone would buy it since its Apple. Soon a feature would be thick protective cover.

Personally I haven’t changed cell-phone in years, but I would soon need a new one. Because of problems with receiving calls, and it just stops working sometimes, asking for a sim-card. So no, I’m not a follower of Steve Jobs.

Read full topic
